intro: Tigridia purruchucana, commonly known as the Mexican fairy lantern, is a striking member of the Iridaceae family native to Mexico. This perennial plant is characterized by its vibrant, tubular flowers that range in color from orange to red, often with a contrasting black or purple stripe. The plant produces tall, leafy stalks that can reach up to 1.5 meters in height, making it a striking addition to gardens. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, requiring minimal water once established. Tigridia purruchucana is also noted for its ability to self-seed, ensuring its presence in the garden year after year.
